This almost certainly is preempted after the round-tripping of the `Pipeline` via the Runner API graph is complete, and will be dropped at that point.

It happens, if the sdk is packaged without the egg_info. In that case pip install, triggers `python setup.py egg_info`. Even though this cmd does not requires protos, it fails because packaged SDK does not contain the gen_protos.py.
I got pulled into something important at work, will try to take a quick look at this - latest monday PST

Have you run the `ValidatesRunner` suite manually? Please do, at least `ParDoTest`, if you haven't.
To reflect the bits that have been broken out into #3281, #3282, and #3283, I have removed those commits from this PR. The tests will no longer pass until the prerequisites are resolved.

This is because of a flakiness in the emission of pushed-back elements. I have a fix for that and will open a PR immediately.

Run Flink ValidatesRunner

@echauchot Could you try and close this PR and open another one? It seems that on a newer PR of mine the Jenkins integration is working again. (I'm just so lazy and don't want to manually find the builds on builds.apache.org... 😅)

Yes, we should process the pushedBackData before sending watermark to the downstream.
LGTM once the ValidatesRunner is successful.
Run Flink ValidatesRunner
This LGTM once Jenkins is giving the green light! 👍

@davorbonaci It's not hight priority since it doesn't fix any immediate problem. I think it would still be good to have because it brings the testing in line with how it should be done and sets a good example. I probably have to rebase this once the update to Flink 1.3 is in: #3284
@davorbonaci I commented on https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-2377. I'm wondering how we should integrate this with the snapshot release process and the actual release process.
Run Flink ValidatesRunner
@peihe I have #2915 open, which changes the translation process a bit and introduces better separation. (As a side effect of introducing asynchronous job submission.)
Close and reopen (https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3286) to test that jenkins integration is working as requested
The Jenkins/GitHub integration is back, just use "retest this please" and other keywords.

LGTM.

@jbonofre do you mind share the methods, I was thinking that this rebase might need two steps, because it if I rebase from `master`, it will conflict with `DSL_SQL`(as there are some breaking api changes to resolve), if i rebase again from `DSL_SQL`, it will conflict with `master`. So separate into two steps by first let DSL_SQL adopt the new breaking apis, then rebase from master.
Closing this one.

@jkff , the code looks in a better shape for a review. 
A short summary of things I have addressed -
1. getEstimatedSizeBytes() and split() methods for BoundedSource

    https://github.com/seshadri-cr/beam/blob/0a0162820009a2e4b0a8e1209161b960b3cbd7b5/sdks/java/io/hcatalog/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/hcatalog/HCatalogIO.java#L263

https://github.com/seshadri-cr/beam/blob/0a0162820009a2e4b0a8e1209161b960b3cbd7b5/sdks/java/io/hcatalog/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/hcatalog/HCatalogIO.java#L289

2. Clean-up of UT setup
    I have removed the UT setup steps from pom file and also refactored UT code. The only config file required now is hive-site.xml

Apart from these I have addressed the code review comments on pom file indentation, java docs and other comments(I have individually replied for each comment)
